name: src/admin.js
Admin
description: Admin Class extends React.Component. To implement a CRUD interface similar to Django Admin you need to extend the Admin class.

name: state
description: Initialize the state of the component

name: get_queryset
description:
This function returns an array of objects that will serve as the
queryset for the admin interface. Typically involves an HTTP request
to a backend.

unknown.tagValue: {object[]} An array of objects. - Objects to display

params.name: list_per_page
params.description: Number items to list per page. Defaults to `list_per_page`

return.description: An array of objects. - Objects to display

name: get_form
description:
This functions returns a JSON Schema Form for editing
the objects in the array returned by get_queryset(). This method needs to be overridden to
so as to return a Form Component for the object.  Learn more on 
JSON schema forms from https://github.com/mozilla-services/react-jsonschema-form 
and JSON Schema from https://spacetelescope.github.io/understanding-json-schema/

return.description: A JSON Schema Form Component.

name: get_live_search
description:
Returns a true/false value. Controls wether search is implement on live input or not.
Can be overriden by the live_search member variable. Default is false.

name: get_field_transforms
description:
Returns an object whose properties are field names corresponding to properties of any object 
in the queryset and whose values are transform functions. The example below will transform each "name"
property of objects in the queryset to upper case in the list display view.

name: get_header_transforms
description:
Returns an object whose properties are field names corresponding to properties of any object 
in the queryset and whose values are transform functions. The example below will transform the header "name" to upper case in the list display view.

name: get_extra_fields
description:
Returns an object whose properties are extra  field names not corresponding to properties of any object 
in the queryset and whose values are display functions. This will create extra fields that are not tied to objects. Extra fields have to be manually included in the `list_display` in order to appear in the list display page. The display functions take the current object being rendered in the table row and  the field name

name: get_list_per_page
description: Returns the number of items to be listed in a page. Can be overridden by `list_per_page`.

return.description: The number of objects in a page

name: get_actions
description:
Gets an actions object whose properties are action names and values are action methods.
This can be overridden by the action member variable. The default "delete" method is not
implemented.

Each actions object property (e.g. "delete") is passed an array of selected objects. One
can then handle those objects. Actions will appear on the list display page within a
dropdown. Selecting an action should have the action method applied to all currently 
selected objects.

return.description: An actions object

name: get_list_display_links
description:
Gets the list/array of properties of the objects in the queryset that are clickable
   when displayed on the list display page. It can be overridden by the member variable
  `list_display_links`. A property is any string that should exist as a property in the objects within 
  a queryset and works with lodash's `_.at` function. 

  The properties "name","address.street" and "emails[0]" are all acceptable by `_.at` in the example below
examples: let object={ name : "any name",{ address : { street : "any"}},emails: ["any@any.com"]}

return.description: A list of properties of the object to be displayed

name: get_list_display
description:
Gets the list/array of properties/field names of the objects in the queryset to be
  displayed on the list display page. It can be overridden by the member variable
  list_display. A property is any string that should exist in the objects within 
  a queryset and works with lodash's _.at function. See more at
  https://lodash.com/docs/#at
examples:
let object={ name : "any name",{ address : { street : "any"}},emails: ["any@any.com"]}
 
  The properties "name","address.street" and "emails[0]" are all acceptable

return.description: A list of properties of the object to be displayed

name: _get_ordered_queryset
description:
Returns an ordered queryset. The method checks to see if sorting is active and sorts
the current queryset based on the sort order.

return.description: An ordered queryset

name: search
description: Implements search. This method should be overridden to implement a custom search

return.description: the queryset as a result of the search

name: has_delete_permission
description:
Grants permission to delete object. This method is not implemented and can be handled via
 implementing actions.

return.description: Returns true is the object has been deleted or false otherwise

name: has_add_permission
description:
Grants permission to add an object. This method controls rendering of the Add 
button

return.description: Returns true is the object can be added or false otherwise

name: has_change_permission
description:
Grants permission to change an object. It disables all links to the add/change page when
enabled

return.description: Returns true is the object can be changed or false otherwise

name: has_module_permission
description: Grants permission to the this admin interface.

return.description: Returns true if access is allowed false otherwise

name: _order_state_arrow
description: This method adds up/down arrows to field headers on the list display page table

name: response_add
description:
This method  should be overriden and called after saving an object in the add/change view.       *  This method is not called at all here but provides hints on what to do after saving
 an object. Change the state display_type to "list", object to "null" and refresh the quer         *  yset.

name: response_change
description:
This method should be overriden and called after saving an object in the add/change view.         *  This method is not called at all here but provides hints on what to do after saving
 an object. Change the state display_type to "list", object to "null" and refresh the quer         *  yset.

name: _create_object_link
description: A private method to wrap a table entry in an tag in the display page. The method checks if permission is given to display links using the has_change_permission method

params.name: object
params.description:
the current object to be displayed as a table
entry in the display page

name: select_all
description:
This method is an event handler that listens to when all objects of the queryset
displayed within a single display page are selected

name: select_one
description:
This method is an event handler that listens when a single objects of the queryset
displayed is selected

name: _get_table_body
description: Generate the table body for the list display page

return.description: An array of table rows <tr/>

name: show_progress
description:
Changes the state property "loading" to true. The state property can be used to show a
progress indicator.

name: hide_progress
description:
Changes the state property "loading" to false. This method  can be used to hide a
progress indicator by inspecting the "loading" property of the state object.

name: render_progress
description: The default progress indicator. Can be overriden.

return.description: A progress indicator component

name: _handle_search
description:
An event listener that listens to the search event. This method calls search method which
implements a custom search. The method uses the "live_search" property to implement live 
search or not.

name: _render_search_field
description: Renders the search component

return.description: A search input field

name: _render_add_button
description: Renders the add object button. Checks to see if permission is given by has_add_permission

return.description: An add button component

name: _render_table
description: Renders the table in the display page. This calls _get_table_header and _get_table_body

return.description: An a table displaying the state queryset set objects

name: action_selected
description: An event listener that listens to actions selected.

name: selectPage
description: An event listener that listens when a page is  selected.

name: nextPage
description: An event listener that listens when the next page is  selected.

name: prevPage
description: An event listener that listens when the previous page is  selected.

name: _render_pagination
description: Renders the pagination UI

return.description: A component that renders the pagination controls

name: _render_actions
description: Renders the actions select component

return.description: A component that renders a select input for all actions in the list display page

name: _render_back_button
description: Renders the back button component in the add/change view

return.description: A component that renders a back button

name: render
description: Renders the admin interface component

return.description: A component that renders the admin interface

name: src/index.js
./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "react-crud-admin",
  "version": "1.0.10",
  "description": "React Admin inspired by DjangoAdmin",
  "main": "public/bundle.js",
  "dependencies": {
    "bootstrap-sass": "^3.3.7",
    "lodash": "",
    "moment": "",
    "moment-timezone": "",
    "react": "",
    "react-dom": "^16.2.0",
    "react-jsonschema-form": "^1.0.0",
    "whatwg-fetch": ""
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "babel-core": "",
    "babel-loader": "",
    "babel-plugin-transform-class-properties": "^6.24.1",
    "babel-plugin-transform-runtime": "",
    "babel-preset-es2015": "",
    "babel-preset-react": "",
    "babel-preset-stage-2": "",
    "css-loader": "",
    "file-loader": "",
    "html-webpack-plugin": "",
    "node-sass": "",
    "resolve-url-loader": "",
    "sass-loader": "",
    "style-loader": "",
    "url-loader": "",
    "webpack": "",
    "webpack-dev-server": ""
  },
  "scripts": {
    "docs": "esdoc -c .esdoc.json",
    "build": "webpack --config webpack.config.production.js --progress --profile --colors",
    "build-publish": "webpack --config webpack.config.publish.js --progress --profile --colors",
    "start": "webpack-dev-server --progress --profile --colors",
    "test": "echo \"Error: no test specified\" && exit 1"
  },
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "https://github.com/mjibril/react-crud-admin.git"
  },
  "author": "Mubarak Jibril",
  "license": "ISC"
}
